class_notes:
(Same as POLS 334 1)
(Examines the political, social, and institutional factors that contribute to or hinder economic and democratic development in contemporary Africa. Includes the topics of authoritarian rule, political accountability, the legacy of colonialism, and ethnic diversity.)
course_description: Politics of sub-Saharan Africa are examined, with emphasis on the major issues of social and political analysis as well as the African economic predicament and its political implications.
sections: Class Nbr: 4788, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: N. Ichino, Status: Open
